page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: As we have said, most of the area allotted to our school is farm land this includes grazing pasture for sheep,cattle and horses.There is also a variety of cereal and root crops. This farm land is owned by a large collection of small farms.A typical example of one of these is Clayhill Farm.Their land covers approximately sixty acres.The main crop is potatoes though they also grow fodder for their animals, as livestock is their principle source of income.They have seventy sheep and twenty cattle which, they sell at the Rugby Market.All the work is done by the farmer except during harvest when casual workers are temporarily employed. This, as we have said, is only on of many similar farms in our area.
